title: COP28: The United Arab Emirates' questionable diplomatic game
summary: This oil-production powerhouse, which is the host of the biggest climate meeting in history, is a terrible model for energy transition.

title: Hamas releases eight total hostages including a French national during extended Gaza truce
summary: Hamas freed six of the hostages hours after releasing two Israeli women Thursday afternoon under a last-minute deal to extend their cease-fire in Gaza by another day.

title: COP28's first day hails the 'loss and damage' fund's implementation as an important step forward
summary: At the opening of the climate conference in Dubai, governments unexpectedly adopted a framework for setting up a fund to help the most vulnerable countries.

title: France's dream to host 2030 Winter Olympics lives on, despite criticism
summary: The International Olympic Committee decided on Wednesday to enter into a 'targeted dialogue' with the promoters of the French Alps bid, ruling out Sweden and Switzerland. Final approval is expected sometime in 2024.

title: 'The fate of the war in Ukraine rests with the Europeans, but they are less determined than Russia'
summary: Columnist Sylvie Kauffmann observes that while the fighting continues, neither army is making headway. Faced with the prospect of a protracted war, the Russians are rearming and the West is questioning its next step.

title: Elliott Erwitt, renowned American photographer, passes away at 95
summary: The photographer was acclaimed for capturing iconic moments in American history as well as quirky photos of dogs and their owners. A stalwart of the Magnum agency, his passing was announced by them on Thursday.

title: Death of Henry Kissinger: The grey areas of an eminence grise
summary: The former head of US diplomacy, who became an influential advisor, will be remembered as the architect of détente with the East. But his involvement in some of history's darkest episodes is now supported by a wealth of evidence.

title: Phasing out fossil fuels: Will COP28 end up breaking the taboo?
summary: Fossil fuel producers have so far kept their product, which is responsible for 80% of greenhouse gas emissions, out of climate negotiations. As the COP28 gets underway in Dubai, this has become an untenable position.

title: Prosecutor requests suspended sentence for French ex-president Sarkozy
summary: In 2021, former President Nicolas Sarkozy was originally sentenced to one year of house arrest. The one-year suspended sentence requested in this appeals trial is more lenient.

title: Before the war, emigration from Gaza to Europe was booming
summary: In 2023, Palestinians were the largest group of new asylum seekers on the Greek islands. They came via Turkey, where they were easily granted access to visas.

title: With the 2030 World Expo, Saudi Arabia dreams of becoming a tourism destination
summary: The organization of the event was entrusted to Riyadh by the Bureau International des Expositions on November 28. It's a way for the Wahhabi kingdom to position itself as an international tourist hotspot.

title: Russia bans 'international LGBT movement' for 'extremism'
summary: The move cements a long crackdown on the community as the Kremlin pushes ultra-conservative social values.

title: Shane MacGowan, The Pogues frontman, dies at 65
summary: MacGowan, an inspiring lead singer who merged Irish melodies and punk passion in his songs, received a Lifetime Achievement Award in 2018 to celebrate his contribution to modern Irish music.

title: Josephine, the slave-owner who whispered in Napoleon's ear
summary: Ridley Scott's biopic, released on November 22, sidesteps a debate that divides historians: Born in Martinique into a family of wealthy landowners, did the future empress push her husband to re-establish slavery overseas in 1802?

title: COP28: Saudi Arabia builds it clean energy transition on oil profits
summary: The world's leading oil producer, with over 15% of the world's proven reserves, the Saudi kingdom remains highly dependent on hydrocarbons for its domestic energy consumption and exports.

title: China has no plans to make commitments under pressure at UN COP28 conference
summary: China continues to authorize the construction of new coal-fired power plants even as solar and wind power production grows at a record pace.

title: UK RMT rail union accepts deal to halt long-running strikes
summary: The other key transport union, Aslef, which represents drivers, has yet to come to an agreement. A new series of rolling strikes across the country are scheduled to go ahead from this weekend.

title: Pope Francis' health forces him to pull out of COP28
summary: A lung inflammation prevented the head of the Catholic Church from attending the climate conference in Dubai.

title: Gaza is on Macron's agenda for his COP28 trip to Dubai and Doha
summary: Paris now favors European sanctions against Israeli settlers who commit violent acts against Palestinians. In Brussels, France has also called for measures against Hamas leaders.

title: Big Ben in London is finally restored, but the rest of Westminster is threatened by decay
summary: Visits to the iconic tower have resumed after five years of work. The final cost has more than doubled compared with the initial budget, due to the building's fragile condition caused by German bombing raids of May 1941.

title: Jane Goodall: 'At COP28, world leaders must make ambitious commitments and honor them!'
summary: As a new COP is held in Dubai until December 12, the British activist and iconic warrior for environmental preservation believes that individual and local commitment is essential to put pressure on companies and politicians.

title: Israel resumes military operations in Gaza after truce expires
summary: Air strikes and ground operations relaunched in the Palestinian enclave on Friday after the seven-day truce expired without any further deal.

title: Brexit's 'chilling' effect on UK investment
summary: After six years of political upheaval following the country's exit from the European Union, London's economic standing has suffered severe damage.

title: Relations between France and Morocco emerge from the Ice Age
summary: The current thaw between the two countries is accompanied by a new approach on the French side. But Rabat's expectations are high, first and foremost on the issue of the Western Sahara.

title: Henry Kissinger, former US secretary of state, has died at 100
summary: A German Jewish emigrant, 'Dear Henry' held some of the most important positions in the United States from 1968 to 1977, including secretary of state under Nixon. He used secret diplomacy in a search for compromise, notably in Vietnam and the Middle East.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Tensions in Jerusalem have reached a boiling point
summary: A shooting in the Holy City, claimed by Hamas, left three Israeli Jews dead on Thursday morning. The attackers came from the Palestinian part of Jerusalem, where security is heavily deployed.

title: At home or on the world stage, Macron's shifting stance on climate
summary: The French President still remains one of the most aggressive climate leaders on the international stage. But this stance is in contrast with how he's handling the environmental struggle in France.

title: The death of Elliott Erwitt, the photographer who captured both human and canine wry comedy
summary: The gifted photoreporter with a ferocious sense of humor died on Wednesday at the age of 95. His famous dog photos somewhat overshadowed his more cutting political pictures.

title: Tensions ramp up between Venezuela and Guyana over oil-rich region
summary: Venezuela is holding a referendum on Sunday, December 3, on the future of the oil-rich region of Essequibo, which takes up two-thirds of Guyana's surface area.

title: Rafael Nadal announces his return to the circuit after a year's absence
summary: The 22-time Grand Slam champion will attempt his comeback at the Brisbane International in January.

title: 'The closer the European elections get, the more they seem like a referendum for or against the EU'
summary: Long protected by its institutions and the strength of the 'Republican front,' France today appears as vulnerable to the far right as some of its European allies, writes Françoise Fressoz.

title: Israel-Hamas:  How Le Monde navigates the image war
summary: This conflict, even more than others in the past, raises the question of where photos come from and how they are used. Whether for the newspaper's print or digital editions, Le Monde's editorial team is constantly faced with crucial choices.

title: Russian activists form resistance networks against Putin and the war in Ukraine
summary: Russian civilians are organizing in order to help army deserters, political prisoners and Ukrainians. They met in Brussels for an 'Anti-War Initiatives Congress.'

title: Israel-Hamas war: Explosions ring out again in Gaza, after seven days of hard-won truce
summary: The truce enabled 80 hostages to be exchanged for 240 Palestinian prisoners, mainly women and children, and humanitarian aid to be brought into the Gaza Strip. It was abruptly broken this morning, negotiations are underway to restore it.

title: UN top court orders Venezuela not to enflame row over disputed territory
summary: The International Court of Justice told Venezuela not to take any action in a dispute with its neighbor Guyana over the Essequibo territory, two days before a referendum on the topic.

title: New York Times investigation reports Israel knew about Hamas' October 7 attack plan
summary: A Hamas document examined by The Times detailed an attack similar to the one on October 7. According to the newspaper, Israeli intelligence officials ignored analysts' warnings and deemed the scenario aspirational.
